issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:

[ERROR] :  UNEXPECTED TOP-LEVEL ERROR:
[ERROR] :  java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

{code}

Test Code : Example code in module.
*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Create a simple project.
2. Add Appcelerator Geofence Module in tiapp.xml
3. Add the test code from example folder.
4. Test it on android 6.0.1

h6.Environment
{code}

  SDK Version                 = 6.0.1 (android-23)

{code}
h6.Actual behavior: 
Geofence module throwing error on android 6.0 with SDK 5.2.2 GA. 

h6.Expected behavior
Geofence module should build  properly  on android 6.0 with SDK 5.2.2 GA 

Thanks
fields.summary: Android 6 : Appcelerator Geofence Module (version 1.1.4) and ti.map throwing error

comments.body:
[~aislam] Is that all that is needed to reproduce this?

Basically, create a new project and add in the module and test on Android 6.0.1?
Seems to be some sort of compilation error.

Could you try using Node 4.2.x as mentioned here: http://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/guide/Titanium_Compatibility_Matrix

I want to rule out that to be the cause of the error since it's mentioned that Node 5.9.0 was used in the initial error report.
[~jnaher] Did you get a chance to look at what Ash is asking? Pls get us an update asap since client needs it soon

[~msamah] So as per the notes, we tested Appcelerator Geofence Module using Node 4.2.0 and Node 4.4.4 , still getting same dexer error. ( this was on HTC one m8, Android 6.0.1)  but with Nexus 7, and node version 4.2.0 (android :6) we found no error

Added the appc info 

Also this is not exclusive from Android 6, this is happening on other android versions.

Based on the logs, the error occurs during compile time. The issue here is compiling.
In the original log, you can see in the log writes {{Running dexer: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_25.jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java "-Xmx512M"}} This Heap size is not enough and thus, it throws a {{java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space}} error.

Please increase the heap size used by adding these properties in your tiapp.xml. It should be contained in the {{<ti:app>}} tag.
{code}
    <property name="android.javac.maxmemory" type="string">1024M</property>
    <property name="android.dx.maxmemory" type="string">2048M</property>
{code}
If it still fails, try increasing the amount of Max Memory used.
[~arohini] [~rramirez] Let me know if this works. If it does, I'll resolve this ticket.

This is probably because GeoFence still uses the whole google-services-library: https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/ti.geofence/tree/master/android/lib, while maps is using just the responsible parts of the lib. We need to update GeoFence libs to fix this

Just a note, you can try ti.map 2.3.1 with ti.geofence 1.1.4 while this is being worked on.
One more step is needed, you need to go to modules/android/ti.geofence/lib/google-play-services.jar and copy and replace that to modules/android/ti.map/lib/google-play-services.jar.
[~pkclark] fyi, once everything is okay, this module needs to be updated in the dashboard.
[~pkclark]Client needs to know when this will be released . Please update

[~arohini] updating modules on dashboard requires an APPTS ticket.  

[~msamah] [~cng] if the module is ready, please file an APPTS ticket linking the module zip AYC.  Thanks.

-I'll create the APPTS ticket.-
Ticket was created earlier.

Ticket is APPTS-8759
Cleaning up older fixed issues. If this issue should not have been closed as fixed, please reopen.
